ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introduction to art, thinking critically about art and technical skills (ie. composition, media, etc.)
Drawing with different medium, figure drawing, portraiture, printmaking, still-life

Each week we focused on a different drawing technique or principle (line/shape, value, sighting/accuracy, figure drawing, perspective). We also learned about some unconventional methods or materials for drawing (printmaking, subtractive mark making).
An intro to a lot of different drawing: charcoal, graphite, and spices for material; shading, line, and color

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: No weaknesses! This course was very well-organized and well-taught by Danny.
Loved it! Wish had more time learning drawing techniques, but also appreciated how it was a survey into many different aspects of art

Strengths: liked having a chunk of time to work on something in class
Weaknesses: I wish there was a little bit more focus- it was hard to do something completely different every week. I wanted more practice with more basics. I wish we had done more charcoal drawings. I felt like the final project was really broad and some people went very far away from drawing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is a good introductory class for people who have no experience with technical drawing skills.
Yes! Super fun class and teaches you all the basics of drawing.

Yes! It felt amazing to have time every week that I had to set aside and really focus on improving my art skills, and I definitely noticed improvement over the course of the semester. I would especially recommend this class with Danny. Their kindness and investment in their students shone through every single class period -- when they were chatting with us before and after class, giving thoughtful and specific feedback about our work, and designing class activities to be fun, engaging, and instructive. Even though there was a wide range of artistic backgrounds, they created a welcoming community within the class, and we all learned from each other during crits. They're also knowledgeable and insightful about art, which was most apparent when they were giving us guidance on our final projects. They could always think of other artists or art traditions that could give us inspiration or add another dimension to our work.
Yes, it was nice to do something completely different than any of my other courses.
